key_insight: UniCardio introduces a unified diffusion-transformer framework that can generate, restore and translate multiple cardiovascular signals (e.g., ECG, PPG) to enable robust abnormality detection and real-time vital‑sign estimation from partial or noisy data.
problem_solved: Addresses the lack of a single generative model that can handle diverse cardiovascular modalities for signal restoration, cross-modal translation and downstream health monitoring tasks in noisy or incomplete real‑world recordings.
method: Combine diffusion probabilistic modeling with a transformer backbone to learn a unified generative prior over multimodal cardiovascular signals.
Train jointly for tasks including denoising/restoration, cross‑modal translation (e.g., PPG↔ECG), and downstream supervision for abnormality detection and vital‑sign regression.
Design inference that supports real‑time restoration and translation for continuous health monitoring from partial/noisy sensor inputs.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners with a versatile, generalizable generative tool for biomedical signal enhancement and modality bridging, reducing the need for modality‑specific pipelines and improving robustness of real‑time health analytics.
visual_elements: Model pipeline diagram showing diffusion + transformer core, inputs (ECG/PPG/ABP), and outputs (restored signals, translated signals, vitals, alerts).
Before/after time‑series plots demonstrating signal restoration from noisy or missing segments.
Cross‑modal translation schematic (e.g., PPG → synthetic ECG) with sample waveform overlays and key downstream outputs (heart rate, arrhythmia flags).
Real‑time dashboard mockup illustrating continuous monitoring, inferred vitals and anomaly detection confidence.
paper_title: Versatile cardiovascular signal generation with a unified diffusion transformer
paper_authors: Zehua Chen, Yuyang Miao, Liyuan Wang, Luyun Fan, Danilo P. Mandic
